signersInfo: Add additional signatories and set appropriate thresholds.
signersCountLimit: Note: Network boundary (Stellar): max. 20 additional signatories.

bestPractices.title: Best practices
bestPractices.text: Keep secret keys secure and do not distribute them unnecessarily.

signerTypeNote: Note: SKM uses only ed25519 signers. For hashX/preAuthTx, use
thresholdLevelsHint: Typically, low = simple changes (e.g., memo, price), medium = payments/trade, high = security-critical changes (e.g., signer/threshholds). Low / Medium / High define the required minimum signer weight for an operation.
thresholdTooHigh: Note: A threshold must not exceed the sum of the weights. Please adjust the values accordingly.

tooltips.signerWeight: Weight of the signers (0–255): Additionally, signers also have voting rights. The weight determines how many votes their signature contributes. When a transaction is sent, all the cast votes are added up. If the predetermined minimum number of votes (Threshold) is reached, the transaction is considered authorized.
tooltips.masterWeight: Weight of the account holder (Master) (0-255): The main key of the account has a voting right. The higher its weight, the more votes its signature counts for. These votes are tallied together with the votes of other signers to determine if the required majority is achieved.
